page.title: 19THE M5 MOTORWAY
page.content: The M5 motorway passes through the eastern section of the block. The M5 runs from Ray Hall junction near West Bromwich, to Devon in the south-west of England. The block contains one junction -number 2- known as Birchley. This junction is used by many local people for private use, but is especially useful for industrial traffic as there are links with all the other major motorways of the country. The M5 links with the M6 at Ray Hall junction and therefore provides easy links to all parts of the West Midlands. Much of the motorway has been constructed as elevated sections and overlooks much of Oldbury.
